intro: Batis maritima, commonly known as sea spurge, is a coastal plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found along shorelines and dunes. Its structure is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Batis maritima plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and preventing erosion.
